source: Nuclear factor kappa-light-chain-enhancer of activated B cells
description: PTM can activate or inhibit signaling pathways like NF-κB, affecting IBD pathogenesis.
Modifications can activate or inhibit signaling pathways such as ERK, influencing the development of IBD.
Changes in protein modifications can affect AKT signaling pathways involved in IBD.
Cytokines like IL-1β are modulated through protein modifications, impacting IBD.
TNF-α levels can be altered by protein modifications, affecting inflammatory responses in IBD.
Modifications can influence IFN-γ release, which plays a role in the immune response in IBD.
